citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The female zebu's front hooves are misshaped and overgrown. The tips of both digits on the right hoof and the outer digit
of the left hoof are beginning to point upward. The tip of inner right digit is bulbus in shape. There appears to be divot,
approximately 1 centimeter in diameter and approximately a half centimeter deep, in the outer digit of the left hoof near
where the hoof wall meets the skin. The zebu walks with an abnormal gait and appears to be painful in the front feet/legs
when walking.
Overgrown hooves can lead to an abnormal gait and potential bone changes that can become chronically painful.
Each exhibitor shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include daily observation of all
animals to assess their health and well-being. Daily observation of animals may be accomplished by someone other than
the attending veterinarian provided that a mechanism of direct and frequent communication with the attending veterinarian
is accomplished so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is
conveyed to the attending veterinarian.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Direct Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The female zebu's front hooves are misshaped and overgrown. The tips of both digits on the right hoof and the outer digit 
of the left hoof are beginning to point upward. The tip of inner right digit is bulbus in shape. There appears to be divot, 
approximately 1 centimeter in diameter and approximately a half centimeter deep, in the outer digit of the left hoof near 
where the hoof wall meets the skin. The zebu walks with an abnormal gait and appears to be painful in the front feet/legs 
when walking. 
Overgrown hooves can lead to an abnormal gait and potential bone changes that can become chronically painful. 
Each exhibitor shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include daily observation of all 
animals to assess their health and well-being. Daily observation of animals may be accomplished by someone other than 
the attending veterinarian provided that a mechanism of direct and frequent communication with the attending veterinarian 
is accomplished so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is 
conveyed to the attending veterinarian. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
